meanings.definition: The act of seeking favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her constant bootlicking towards the boss was obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The bootlicking of the politician towards the wealthy donors was shameless.
meanings.sent3: The bootlicking of the cat towards its owner for treats was both amusing and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The bootlicking of the student towards the teacher for a better grade was transparent.
meanings.sent5: The bootlicking of the dog towards its owner for a belly rub was endearing.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: The bootlicking always seemed to get ahead in the company due to their constant flattery.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the bootlicking of the group, always trying to please others for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The bootlicking at the party was so over-the-top that it became comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: He was a master of bootlicking, always knowing the right words to say to get what he wanted.
meanings.sent5: The bootlicking's behavior was so obvious that it became a running joke among their friends.
